poem:
**Southport Morning**

broken glass
       in the dawn
murmurs
          of the broom

blood
   yesterday's fallen paint
carried away
     in today's basket

human hands—
        tender,
       hopelessly bending
the bright light
          into forgiveness
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Southport stabbing latest: rioting ‘thugs’ have disrespected victims’ families, local MP says 8.59am BST Here are some of the latest images coming out of the newswires from Southport. There is a huge community effort underway to clean up the area (around Sussex Road and St Luke’s Road) after last night’s violence: 8.49am BST What exactly happened in the Southport riot last night? Josh Halliday, the Guardian’s north of England editor, has been reporting from Southport". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
